company: Classic Technologies & Business Solutions Pvt. Ltd.
job_description:
Senior Specialist - DBA

About the Role

We are looking for an Application Database Administrator (DBA) to join our DevOps team and play a key role in ensuring the performance, scalability, and reliability of our product databases. You will work closely with product engineering teams to optimize data design, support release cycles, and enable continuous performance improvement across our applications.

Eligibility

  • 5+ years of experience managing SQL Server databases in production environments.
  • Strong expertise in query optimization, execution plan analysis, and indexing strategies to improve application performance.
  • Experience working with DevOps teams and contributing to CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code (IaC), and automated deployments.
  • Proven ability to collaborate with developers and architects to design efficient data models and ensure database alignment with product architecture.
  • Proficiency in SQL Server Profiler, Extended Events, Dynamic Management Views (DMVs), and Performance Monitor for troubleshooting.
  • Hands-on experience with high availability and disaster recovery (AlwaysOn, clustering, replication, log shipping).
  • Scripting proficiency in T-SQL and PowerShell for automation and maintenance tasks.
  • Working knowledge of cloud-hosted databases (Azure SQL / AWS RDS) and monitoring tools.
  • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum practices and cross-functional collaboration.
  • Strong problem-solving mindset, ownership orientation, and clear communication skills.

Good to Have

  • Experience in application-level performance tuning, including ORM optimization (Entity Framework, Hibernate).
  • Exposure to ETL/data integration (SSIS, Data Factory) or BI tools (Power BI).
  • Awareness of microservices, API performance, or event-driven architectures.
  • Familiarity with containerized environments (Docker/Kubernetes) and infrastructure automation (Terraform, ARM templates).

Key Responsibilities

  • Work as part of the DevOps team, contributing to the reliability and performance of production database systems.
  • Collaborate with product engineering teams to design scalable schemas, tune SQL queries, and optimize application–database interactions.
  • Participate in application release cycles, ensuring smooth deployment of database changes through CI/CD pipelines.
  • Proactively monitor and improve database performance, addressing slow queries, blocking, and I/O issues.
  • Develop and implement automation scripts for backup, maintenance, and environment provisioning.
  • Maintain robust backup, recovery, and disaster recovery strategies.
  • Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with organizational standards.
  • Support capacity planning, load testing, and performance benchmarking for product scalability.
  • Provide insights on data usage patterns and contribute to product-level performance reviews.
  • Document database standards, architecture, and optimization strategies for internal knowledge sharing.
  • Continuously evaluate and recommend technologies to enhance data performance, observability, and reliability.

Contact Information

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@ctebs.com

job_description:
Senior Software Developer

About Us

At Classic Technologies, we are driving digital transformation in the garment manufacturing industry and beyond. Our mission is to design scalable, secure, and high-performing enterprise solutions that improve efficiency and create measurable impact. We are seeking a Software Architect who will play a pivotal role in shaping our product ecosystem and ensuring technical excellence.

Role Overview

As a Senior Specialist, you will be responsible for designing end-to-end software solutions, defining architectural standards, and guiding development teams in implementing modern, scalable, and maintainable applications. You will collaborate with business stakeholders and product teams to transform requirements into robust, enterprise-grade architectures.

Key Responsibilities

  • Own the technical architecture across multiple enterprise applications (Angular + Java + MSSQL).
  • Design and enforce architecture principles, coding standards, and best practices.
  • Architect solutions using microservices, APIs, and modular design.
  • Optimize database design and query performance in MSSQL.
  • Collaborate with DevOps teams to ensure CI/CD automation, cloud deployment, and scalability.
  • Perform architectural reviews, code reviews, and performance assessments.
  • Mentor developers, guiding them on design patterns, frameworks, and performance tuning.
  • Evaluate emerging technologies and propose adoption where beneficial.
  • Ensure security, scalability, and maintainability of enterprise systems.

Core Technologies (Must Have)

  • Frontend: Angular (latest versions), RxJS, State Management (NgRx or similar).
  • Backend: Java (Spring Boot, REST APIs, Microservices, JPA/Hibernate).
  • Database: Microsoft SQL Server (Schema design, Stored Procedures, Query Optimization, Indexing).

Relevant Supporting Technologies (Nice to Have but Valuable)

  • Cloud Platforms: Azure / AWS (preferred: Azure for MSSQL alignment).
  • DevOps Tools: Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps.
  • APIs & Integrations: REST, GraphQL, gRPC.
  • Caching & Performance: Redis, Memcached.
  • Messaging & Event-driven Systems: Kafka, RabbitMQ, Azure Service Bus.
  • Authentication & Security: OAuth2, JWT, SSO, Keycloak/Okta.
  • Testing Frameworks: JUnit, Mockito, Jasmine/Karma, Cypress.
  • Monitoring & Logging: ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana), Prometheus, Grafana.
  • Other Databases (Optional Exposure): NoSQL (MongoDB, Cosmos DB).

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
  • 6+ years of experience in software development.
  • Proven experience in designing scalable, distributed systems.
  • Strong understanding of design patterns, system integration, and enterprise architecture principles.
  • Excellent communication, leadership, and mentoring skills.

Preferred Industry Experience

  • Prior work in manufacturing, ERP, supply chain, or enterprise SaaS systems.

What We Offer

  • Opportunity to define the architecture of enterprise-level solutions impacting global garment manufacturing.
  • Collaborative environment with a talented team of developers and QA engineers.
  • Competitive compensation with performance-linked incentives.
  • Access to learning programs, certifications, and growth pathways toward Technical Leadership.

Contact Information

job_description:
Cloud DevOps Engineer

We are seeking an experienced Cloud DevOps Engineer with strong expertise in designing, building, and operating secure, large-scale, multi-tenant cloud platforms. The ideal candidate will have deep hands-on experience with Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC), cloud networking, data platform components, automation, and operational support for high-availability environments.

Responsibilities

  • Build and configure cloud environments using IaC tools (Terraform, Bicep, ARM, or similar).
  • Implement multi-tenant infrastructure with complete isolation across compute, storage, identity, and networking layers.
  • Deploy core platform components such as:
  • Cloud storage and database services
  • Data processing and analytics services
  • Workload orchestration, compute clusters, and metadata/catalog tools
  • Design and configure cloud networking, including VNets, private endpoints, firewalls, routing, and secure API access.
  • Implement HA/DR configurations, backup policies, and monitoring foundations.
  • Develop reusable IaC modules and provisioning templates for onboarding new environments or tenants.
  • Build CI/CD workflows for infrastructure deployment and configuration changes.
  • Automate operational tasks such as environment creation, access setup, and network configuration.
  • Monitor cloud resources, compute performance, network connectivity, and storage systems.
  • Troubleshoot infrastructure issues across compute, identity, storage, and networking.
  • Apply patches, upgrades, and configuration changes in line with best practices.
  • Optimize cloud performance and cost across compute, storage, and networking workloads.
  • Support onboarding of new teams or business units by provisioning secure and isolated environments.
  • Maintain detailed documentation for infrastructure, IaC modules, network diagrams, and operational procedures.
  • Train internal teams on cloud administration, IaC usage, monitoring tools, and day-to-day cloud operations.

Key Skills Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience as a Cloud Engineer or similar role.
  • Strong, hands-on experience with Azure or another primary cloud provider.
  • Advanced proficiency in IaC tools (ARM, Terraform preferred).
  • Strong understanding of multi-tenant architecture, resource isolation, and cloud governance.
  • Hands-on experience with cloud networking (firewalls, routing, VPN, private endpoints).
  • Familiarity with data platform components such as analytics engines, metadata catalogs, and orchestration services.
  • Experience with CI/CD, Git, and automation pipelines.
  • Excellent troubleshooting and performance optimization skills.

Preferred Certifications

  • Azure Administrator / Azure Solutions Architect
  • Terraform Associate
  • Cloud Security or Networking certifications

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@beinex.com
summary: Seeking a Cloud DevOps Engineer to build and operate secure, multi-tenant cloud platforms using IaC and automation. Responsibilities include cloud networking, CI/CD, monitoring, and troubleshooting for high-availability environments.

job_description:
Security Architect

We are hiring an experienced Security Architect with deep expertise in cloud security, identity management, data protection, and compliance frameworks. The role focuses on designing and implementing security architectures for multi-tenant cloud platforms, ensuring isolation, privacy, encryption, and operational security aligned with best practices.

Responsibilities

  • Define end-to-end cloud security architectures with emphasis on multi-tenant isolation, secure data flows, and identity governance.
  • Design IAM models including RBAC, MFA, privilege separation, and zero-trust principles.
  • Architect encryption strategies for data at rest and in transit, key management, secret rotation, and certificate handling.
  • Embed privacy-by-design and compliance-by-design into platform and component architectures.
  • Design and validate access patterns, audit logging strategies, and monitoring frameworks.
  • Develop governance models covering change management, incident response, data classification, and retention.
  • Configure identity, access controls, network security rules, encryption, certificates, and monitoring agents.
  • Perform hardening of cloud resources, compute clusters, storage, and data services according to industry standards.
  • Integrate security tools for data discovery, classification, access governance, encryption policy enforcement, and auditability.
  • Support vulnerability assessments, penetration tests, and risk remediation.
  • Establish dashboards and alerts for security monitoring using SIEM tools.
  • Lead threat analysis, incident response, forensic investigations, and root cause analysis.
  • Conduct regular access reviews, configuration audits, and isolation checks.
  • Oversee security patching, baseline updates, identity audits, and configuration compliance.
  • Ensure operational security coverage across all tenants/environments.
  • Produce security SOPs, runbooks, incident response plans, and governance workflows.
  • Deliver security training for engineering, operations, and administrative teams.
  • Ensure full documentation and knowledge transfer for ongoing operational security activities.

Key Skills Requirements

  • 7+ years of experience in cybersecurity, cloud security architecture, or related domains.
  • Deep expertise with cloud IAM, RBAC, authentication flows, and identity governance.
  • Strong knowledge of cloud networking security (firewalls, segmentation, VPN, private networking).
  • Hands-on experience with data security tools (classification, cataloging, access governance, encryption management).
  • Expertise in encryption, key management, audit logging, and SIEM/SOAR.
  • Understanding of multi-tenant security challenges and proven ability to design secure isolation patterns.
  • Strong understanding of compliance, data protection, and privacy principles.

Preferred Certifications

  • CISSP, CCSP, CISM
  • Azure Security Engineer / Cloud Security certifications
  • ISO 27001 or other governance framework certifications

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@beinex.com
summary: Seeking an experienced Security Architect for cloud security, identity, and data protection. Role involves designing and implementing secure multi-tenant cloud architectures.

job_description:
DevOps Architect

Company: Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: http://www.reflectionsglobal.com Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com Closing Date: November 28, 2025 Job Published: November 25, 2025

Brief Description

We are looking for candidates with 8+ years of experience for this role.

Description

The DevOps Architect is responsible for defining and driving the end-to-end DevOps strategy, tooling, and practices for mission-critical, on-premises and hybrid applications. This role designs and oversees CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure-as-code, environment strategy, and observability to ensure that applications are built, tested, released, and operated in a reliable, secure, and repeatable manner across multiple data centres and DR sites. The DevOps Architect works closely with application, infrastructure, security, and operations teams to enable seamless modernization of legacy systems into containerized and microservices-based architectures, while maintaining strict uptime, performance, and compliance requirements.

Responsibilities

  • Define the overall DevOps architecture, standards, and practices for building, testing, releasing, and operating applications across multiple on-premises environments.
  • Design and implement CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Azure DevOps, Jenkins) for Java, .NET, front-end, GIS, database systems, and integration services, ensuring automated build, test, security scanning, and deployment.
  • Lead the DevOps enablement for modernization of legacy applications into microservices and containerized workloads, ensuring coexistence with existing monolithic and legacy stacks during the transition.
  • Design deployment strategies (e.g., blue-green, canary, rolling updates) suitable for mission-critical, 24x7 systems running in multi-datacenter and DR setups with strict SLAs.
  • Define and implement infrastructure-as-code (IaC) standards (e.g., Terraform, Ansible) for provisioning and managing infrastructure, middleware, Kubernetes/OpenShift clusters, and shared services in a consistent, repeatable way.
  • Collaborate closely with Application, Integration, Database, Infrastructure, Security, and Network teams to ensure that pipelines, deployment patterns, and operational processes align with existing on-prem standards, DR strategies, and compliance requirements.
  • Establish and enforce configuration management practices (e.g., environment-specific configurations, secrets management, feature flags) across all environments.
  • Define and implement logging, monitoring, and alerting standards (e.g., ELK/EFK, Prometheus, Grafana, APM tools) to ensure observability of applications, services, and infrastructure.
  • Drive adoption of DevSecOps practices by integrating security checks (SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, container scanning) into CI/CD pipelines and release processes.
  • Define environment strategy and naming conventions and ensure consistent topology, tagging, and baseline configurations across multiple environments.
  • Implement automated quality gates in CI/CD pipelines, including unit tests, integration tests, security checks, code coverage, and policy compliance checks.
  • Work with Security teams to align DevSecOps practices with organizational policies and compliance requirements, including auditability and evidence collection for releases.
  • Drive continuous improvement of build and deployment times, pipeline reliability, and overall development productivity.
  • Contribute to and review operational runbooks, incident response procedures, and DR playbooks from a DevOps and automation perspective.

Preferred Skills

Technical Skills

  • Strong hands-on experience with CI/CD tools such as Azure DevOps Pipelines, Jenkins, or GitLab CI for automating build, test, and deployment workflows.
  • Proficiency with source control and branching strategies (e.g., GitFlow, trunk-based development) and integration with work item/issue tracking.
  • Solid experience with containerization and orchestration using Docker and Kubernetes/OpenShift in on-premises or hybrid environments.
  • Practical knowledge of infrastructure-as-code tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible) for provisioning and configuring compute, storage, networking, and platform services.
  • Strong understanding of Linux-based environments, shell scripting, and automation for application and infrastructure operations.
  • Experience with centralized logging and monitoring stacks (e.g., Elastic Stack/ELK/EFK, Prometheus, Grafana) and APM tools (e.g., Dynatrace, AppDynamics, New Relic).
  • Good understanding of networking fundamentals relevant to DevOps (e.g., load balancers, ingress controllers, DNS, certificates, firewall rules, service mesh concepts).
  • Experience integrating artifact repositories (e.g., Nexus, Artifactory, Azure Artifacts) with CI/CD pipelines to manage build outputs and dependencies.
  • Familiarity with service mesh or advanced traffic management concepts (e.g., Istio, Linkerd, API gateways) as part of blue-green/canary deployment strategies.
  • Working knowledge of security tools and scanners (e.g., SonarQube, OWASP ZAP, Snyk, Trivy, Aqua, or similar) integrated with CI/CD.
  • Knowledge of scripting/programming languages used for automation (e.g., Bash, PowerShell, Python, or Groovy).
  • Exposure to cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and hybrid DevOps patterns (on-prem plus cloud) even if current deployment is primarily on-premises.
  • Experience with GitOps approaches using tools like Argo CD or Flux for Kubernetes-based deployments.
  • Familiarity with SRE practices (e.g., error budgets, SLOs/SLIs, reliability engineering) and how they tie into monitoring and alerting design.
  • Experience with secrets management tools (e.g., HashiCorp Vault, Key Management Services) and policy-as-code tools (e.g., Open Policy Agent, Azure Policy).

Experience and Soft Skills

  • 8+ years of experience in DevOps, build and release engineering, or infrastructure engineering, with at least 3–4 years in a lead/architect role.
  • Proven experience implementing DevOps practices for large-scale, distributed, mission-critical systems with strict uptime and performance SLAs.
  • Experience working in environments with multiple data centres and DR sites, including supporting failover, recovery testing, and environment synchronization.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with architects, developers, testers, infrastructure, security, and operations teams.
  • Ability to document DevOps architectures, pipelines, standards, and operational runbooks clearly and consistently.
  • Prior involvement in modernization projects where legacy applications were incrementally migrated to microservices and containers while maintaining business continuity.
  • Experience coordinating releases across multiple teams and systems, including change management and release governance in regulated or high-security environments.

Important Notice Regarding Job Applications

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com along with their notice period, current and expected CTC details.

Fraud Alert: Please be aware that some fraudsters are promising jobs with Reflections Info Systems for a fee. Reflections Info Systems never asks for payment for job opportunities. We communicate with candidates exclusively through our official website or LinkedIn, and all employment-related emails originate from our official HR email address. For any clarifications or to report suspicious activity, please contact careers@reflectionsinfos.com.
summary: Seeking an experienced DevOps Architect to define and drive DevOps strategy, tooling, and practices for on-premises and hybrid applications. This role focuses on CI/CD, IaC, and observability for reliable application delivery.

job_description:
Junior Product Support Executive

Company: NeedStreet Web Technologies (P) Ltd Location: Padmanabham, Technopark, Trivandrum, 695581 Website: http://www.continuouscare.io

Job Published: 25,Nov 2025 Closing Date: 25,Dec 2025 Contact Email: jobs@needstreet.com

Brief Description

We are seeking enthusiastic individuals who grew up with technology and are passionate about helping others succeed with it. If you are someone who naturally becomes the "go-to tech person" among friends and family, enjoys explaining how things work, and gets satisfaction from solving puzzles, this role could be perfect for you.

What You'll Do

  • Be the friendly voice that helps healthcare providers and their teams make the most of our platform.
  • Investigate and resolve questions about product features through conversations, emails, and support tickets.
  • Create helpful content: write support articles, record tutorial videos, and build guides that make complex features easy to understand.
  • Work alongside our product and technical teams to understand customer needs and improve our platform.
  • Learn the ins and outs of digital healthcare technology, including how clinics, hospitals, and healthcare providers use our tools.

What We're Looking For

You don't need prior work experience, but you should have:

  • Digital Fluency: Comfortable navigating apps (mobile and web), exploring new features without hesitation, and learning software quickly.
  • Communication Skills: Ability to explain technical concepts in simple terms, both in writing and conversation. Enjoy teaching others and have patience when someone doesn't understand something the first time.
  • Problem-Solving Mindset: Enjoy figuring out why something doesn't work. Ask good questions and think through possibilities systematically.
  • Curiosity: Genuinely want to understand how things work and aren't satisfied with surface-level knowledge.
  • Customer Empathy: Care about making people's experience better and take pride in helping them succeed.
  • Self-Motivation: Do not wait to be told what to do—see what needs attention and take initiative.
  • Adaptability: Comfortable with change and can switch between different types of tasks throughout the day.

Preferred Skills (Skills That Will Help You Succeed)

  • Comfortable creating and editing content (articles, documents, presentations).
  • Experience making videos or screen recordings (even casual ones for friends/social media).
  • Good attention to detail—you notice when something is off.
  • Basic understanding of how databases, APIs, or web services work (not mandatory, but helpful).
  • Interest in healthcare, wellness, or making a social impact.

What You'll Gain

  • Deep knowledge of B2B SaaS operations and healthcare technology.
  • Hands-on experience with product support, customer success, and technical communication.
  • Mentorship from experienced team members who will invest in your growth.
  • Exposure to real-world problem-solving with a global user base.
  • A foundation for growth into product management, customer success, or technical roles.

Why ContinuousCare?

You'll work at the intersection of healthcare and technology, supporting a platform that genuinely improves patient care and healthcare delivery. We value fresh perspectives, encourage learning, and believe great attitudes and genuine curiosity matter more than prior experience.

To apply, email your resume and a brief note about yourself to: jobs@needstreet.com

Note: This role requires you to work from the office. Location – Technopark, Trivandrum.
summary: Seeking enthusiastic individuals passionate about technology for a Junior Product Support role. Help users, resolve issues, create content, and learn about digital healthcare.

job_description:
Test Architect at Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd

Location: Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India Closing Date: November 28, 2025 Job Published: November 25, 2025

Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com

Brief Description

We are looking for candidates with 8+ years of experience for this role.

Description

The Test Architect is responsible for defining and governing the overall testing strategy, frameworks, and practices for mission-critical enterprise platforms running across multiple on-premises data centres and a DR site. This role ensures that functional, integration, regression, performance, security, GIS, and DR testing are designed and executed in a consistent, automated, and repeatable way across legacy and modernized components. The Test Architect works closely with application, integration, GIS, infrastructure, DevOps, and security teams to enable high-quality releases as the platform transitions from monolithic and legacy stacks to microservices, modern web UIs, and containerized workloads.

Responsibilities

  • Define the end-to-end test strategy and test architecture for a large, mission-critical platform, covering functional, integration, regression, system, UAT support, and non-functional testing (performance, reliability, security, usability).
  • Design a comprehensive test approach that supports coexistence of legacy and modernized components (web, desktop, mobile/MDT, APIs, GIS services), ensuring regression coverage across phased rollouts and multiple data centres/DR.
  • Establish and govern test automation frameworks for APIs, UI (web and mobile), and backend services, promoting high levels of automation in CI/CD pipelines.
  • Define test plans and standards for integration testing across modules and external systems (for example, government systems, telephony, GIS, messaging platforms, and databases).
  • Collaborate with DevOps and Infrastructure teams to align test environments, environment configuration, and data refresh strategies with deployment models, including active-active DC and DR.
  • Define non-functional testing strategies (for example, performance, load, stress, soak, failover, and DR testing) and ensure they are executed as part of major releases.
  • Set up and maintain standards for test data management, including anonymization or masking where needed, to ensure realistic and secure test datasets.
  • Provide leadership and guidance to QA and test teams, ensuring consistent application of test processes, tools, and best practices across projects.
  • Define and maintain a test governance model, including entry/exit criteria, defect severity/priority definitions, and release readiness criteria.
  • Collaborate with Security and DevSecOps teams to ensure security testing (for example, SAST/DAST, vulnerability scanning) is included in the overall test strategy and pipeline.
  • Support UAT and business testing by providing guidance on test scenarios, acceptance criteria, and tools for user-facing validation.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement of testing practices, tools, and metrics, using data-driven insights to enhance quality and speed of delivery.
  • Participate in incident reviews and post-release retrospectives to identify testing gaps and update strategies accordingly.

Preferred Skills

Technical Skills

  • Strong experience designing and implementing test automation frameworks for web UIs (for example, Selenium, Playwright, Cypress), APIs (for example, REST-assured, Postman/Newman, Karate), and backend services.
  • Solid understanding of testing strategies for microservices and distributed systems, including contract testing, integration testing, and end-to-end scenario testing.
  • Experience with performance and load testing tools (for example, JMeter, Gatling, Locust) to validate throughput, latency, and resource utilization under realistic and peak loads.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools (for example, Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitLab CI) and integrating automated tests into pipelines as quality gates.
  • Understanding of testing in complex, on-premises environments that involve multiple application tiers, GIS services (for example, ArcGIS), databases (for example, Oracle), and message buses/streaming platforms (for example, Kafka).
  • Knowledge of test management tools (for example, Azure Test Plans, JIRA/Xray, Zephyr, or similar) for planning, execution, and traceability.
  • Good understanding of software quality principles, risk-based testing, and test design techniques (for example, boundary value analysis, equivalence partitioning, combinatorial testing).
  • Experience with service virtualization and mocking tools to simulate unavailable or third-party systems during integration testing.
  • Familiarity with test automation for desktop or rich-client applications where relevant.
  • Understanding of observability and logging tools (for example, ELK/EFK, APM solutions) and how they can be used to support testing, troubleshooting, and root cause analysis.
  • Knowledge of testing strategies for GIS applications (for example, validating map layers, geocoding accuracy, routing results, and real-time location updates).

Experience and Soft Skills

  • 8+ years of experience in software testing and quality engineering, with at least 3 - 4 years in a Test Architect or equivalent senior QA leadership role.
  • Proven experience defining and implementing test strategies for large-scale, mission-critical systems with strict uptime and performance SLAs.
  • Experience working in environments with multiple data centres and DR, including participation in failover and DR testing exercises.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work with architects, developers, DevOps, GIS, infrastructure, and business stakeholders.
  • Ability to document test strategies, test architectures, standards, and procedures clearly and concisely.

Experience

  • Prior involvement in modernization projects where legacy applications and UIs was gradually replaced with microservices and modern web front ends, with sustained test coverage across the transition.
  • Experience working in regulated or high-compliance environments, ensuring traceability of requirements to test cases, results, and defects for audit purposes.

Secondary Skills

Technical Skills and Experience

  • Exposure to SRE and reliability engineering concepts (for example, SLOs, SLIs, error budgets) and how testing can support reliability goals.
  • Experience with chaos engineering or resilience testing tools and practices.
  • Familiarity with model-based testing, property-based testing, or other advanced testing techniques.
  • Knowledge of test data generation tools and synthetic data strategies.

Application Process

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com along with their notice period, current and expected CTC details.

Important Note: Please be aware that some fraudsters are promising jobs with Reflections Info Systems for a fee. Reflections Info Systems never seeks any payment for job opportunities. We contact candidates exclusively through our official website or LinkedIn, and all employment-related emails are sent from the official HR email ID. Please contact careers@reflectionsinfos.com for any clarification or alerts on this subject.
summary: Seeking an experienced Test Architect to define and govern testing strategies for mission-critical platforms. This role focuses on ensuring quality across diverse systems during modernization efforts.

job_description:
Security Architect at Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd

Location: Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com Closing Date: November 28, 2025 Job Published: November 25, 2025

Brief Description: Reflections Info Systems is seeking a highly experienced Security Architect with over 10 years of experience to define and govern security architecture for critical on-premises enterprise platforms.

Responsibilities:

  • Define and govern the security architecture for mission-critical, on-premises enterprise platforms across multiple data centers and a disaster recovery site.
  • Design and review security controls for applications, integrations, data, infrastructure, and identities to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability.
  • Collaborate with application, integration, infrastructure, network, and DevOps teams to embed security into system modernization (legacy to microservices/containerized workloads).
  • Meet strict regulatory, audit, and compliance requirements.
  • Define the overall security architecture and reference patterns for applications, APIs, integrations, and data flows.
  • Establish and maintain security standards for identity and access management (SSO, MFA, RBAC), network security (segmentation, firewalls, VPNs), and endpoint protection.
  • Ensure secure design of microservices, web applications, mobile/MDT clients, and external-facing APIs.
  • Ensure secure configurations of servers, containers, Kubernetes/OpenShift clusters, databases, load balancers, and WAFs.
  • Define and review security controls for integrations with external systems.
  • Oversee the implementation of logging, monitoring, and alerting for security events, integrating with SIEM/SOC teams.
  • Drive secure SDLC and DevSecOps practices, embedding security requirements, threat modeling, and security testing (SAST, DAST, dependency and container scanning) into CI/CD pipelines.
  • Conduct architecture and design reviews for new solutions and change requests.
  • Define and maintain security baselines, hardening guides, and configuration benchmarks.
  • Lead or contribute to threat modeling exercises and risk assessments.
  • Define and review policies for secure access to environments.
  • Support incident response and forensic analysis activities.
  • Contribute to business continuity and disaster recovery planning from a security perspective.
  • Provide security guidance and coaching to technical teams.
  • Integrate security tools and scanners into CI/CD pipelines.
  • Manage secrets management tools and practices.
  • Implement endpoint and server hardening practices.
  • Apply encryption technologies to APIs, services, and data stores.

Preferred Skills:

Technical Skills:

  • Strong understanding of security architecture principles for enterprise applications, APIs, microservices, and integrations in on-premises and hybrid environments.
  • Hands-on knowledge of identity and access management concepts and technologies (Active Directory/LDAP, SSO, MFA, RBAC, OAuth2, OpenID Connect, JWT).
  • Good understanding of application security fundamentals (OWASP Top 10, secure coding practices, input validation, output encoding, secure session/token management).
  • Experience with network security controls (firewalls, VPNs, reverse proxies, WAFs, network zoning, secure remote access).
  • Familiarity with securing containerized workloads and orchestration platforms (Docker, Kubernetes/OpenShift).
  • Knowledge of database and data security (encryption at rest/transit, database hardening, least privilege).
  • Experience with security logging and monitoring, SIEM platforms, and security analytics.
  • Experience integrating security tools and scanners into CI/CD pipelines (SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, container image scanning).
  • Familiarity with secrets management tools and practices.
  • Knowledge of endpoint and server hardening practices (CIS benchmarks).
  • Working knowledge of encryption technologies (TLS, certificates, key management).
  • Exposure to zero-trust architecture concepts.
  • Experience with policy-as-code and security-as-code approaches.
  • Familiarity with SRE and observability concepts.
  • Experience with data classification, data loss prevention (DLP), and privacy-by-design principles.

Experience and Soft Skills:

  • 10+ years of experience in information security, application security, or infrastructure security, with at least 3-4 years in a security architect role.
  • Proven experience designing or reviewing security architectures for large-scale, mission-critical systems.
  • Experience in multi-datacentre and DR-enabled environments.
  • Strong ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and influence secure design decisions.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Prior involvement in modernization projects.
  • Experience in environments subject to regulatory, audit, or compliance requirements (ISO 27001, SOC 2, PCI DSS).

Certifications:

  • Security certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or SABSA.
  • Technical security certifications such as CCSP, GIAC, or vendor-specific security certifications.
  • Formal training or certification in secure software development, DevSecOps, or application security testing.

Important Note: No payment is ever sought for jobs at Reflections Info Systems. All communication is through official channels. Contact careers@reflectionsinfos.com for any clarifications.

To Apply: Interested candidates may forward their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com along with their notice period, current and expected CTC details.
summary: Seeking a Security Architect with 10+ years of experience to define and govern security architecture for on-premises enterprise platforms. Responsibilities include designing security controls, collaborating with teams, and driving secure SDLC practices.
